cinnamon.engine.utils

Interface BoundingTree<E extends Partitionable>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - element to partition.

    public interface BoundingTree<E extends Partitionable>

    Organizes Partitionables by their Bounds for spatial containment and intersection testing.

    Created by chris on 6/14/2017.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(E partitionable)
      Adds a Partitionable.
      boolean contains(E partitionable)
      Checks if a given Partitionable is in the tree.
      E[] getContained(E[] contained, Bounds capture, int limit)
      Array version of getContained(List, Bounds, int).
      List<E> getContained(List<E> contained, Bounds capture, int limit)
      Adds to a List each Partitionable, up to limit instances, such that each instance b is contained by the given Bounds described as (capture.contains(b)).
      E[] getIntersections(E[] intersections, Bounds capture, int limit)
      Array version of getIntersections(List, Bounds, int).
      E[] getIntersections(E[] contained, Point point, int limit)
      Array version of getIntersections(List, Point, int).
      List<E> getIntersections(List<E> intersections, Bounds capture, int limit)
      Adds to a List each Partitionable, up to limit instances, such that each instance b intersects with the given Bounds described as (capture.intersects(b)).
      List<E> getIntersections(List<E> contained, Point point, int limit)
      Adds to a List each Partitionable, up to limit instances, such that each instance b intersects with the given Point described as (b.contains(point)).
      default boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if Partitionable count == 0.
      boolean remove(E partitionable)
      Removes a Partitionable.
      int size()
      Gets the number of Partitionables in the tree.
      boolean update(E partitionable)
      Updates if necessary a Partitionable's position in the tree's hierarchy should its position be invalid.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        boolean add(E partitionable)

        Adds a Partitionable.

        Parameters:
        partitionable - partitionable.
        Returns:
        true if the value was successfully added, false if already in the tree.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if partitionable is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the partitionable has a property disallowed by the tree.

      • contains

        boolean contains(E partitionable)

        Checks if a given Partitionable is in the tree.

        Parameters:
        partitionable - partitionable.
        Returns:
        false if the partitionable is not partitioned in the tree.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if partitionable or its bounds is null.

      • getContained

        E[] getContained(E[] contained,
                 Bounds capture,
                 int limit)

        Array version of getContained(List, Bounds, int).

        Parameters:
        contained - array of results.
        capture - containing bounds.
        limit - max number of partitionables.
        Returns:
        contained, or null if none were contained.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if contained array or capture is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if limit <= 0.

      • getContained

        List<E> getContained(List<E> contained,
                     Bounds capture,
                     int limit)

        Adds to a List each Partitionable, up to limit instances, such that each instance b is contained by the given Bounds described as (capture.contains(b)).

        Parameters:
        contained - list of results.
        capture - containing bounds.
        limit - max number of partitionables.
        Returns:
        contained, or null if none were contained.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if contained list or capture is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if limit <= 0.

      • getIntersections

        E[] getIntersections(E[] intersections,
                     Bounds capture,
                     int limit)

        Array version of getIntersections(List, Bounds, int).

        Parameters:
        intersections - list of results.
        capture - intersecting bounds.
        limit - max number of partitionables.
        Returns:
        intersections, or null if none intersected.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if intersections list or capture is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if limit <= 0.

      • getIntersections

        E[] getIntersections(E[] contained,
                     Point point,
                     int limit)

        Array version of getIntersections(List, Point, int).

        Parameters:
        contained - array of results.
        point - intersecting point.
        limit - max number of partitionables.
        Returns:
        contained, or null if none were contained.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if contained array or point is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if limit <= 0.

      • getIntersections

        List<E> getIntersections(List<E> intersections,
                         Bounds capture,
                         int limit)

        Adds to a List each Partitionable, up to limit instances, such that each instance b intersects with the given Bounds described as (capture.intersects(b)).

        Parameters:
        intersections - list of results.
        capture - intersecting bounds.
        limit - max number of partitionables.
        Returns:
        intersections, or null if none intersected.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if intersections list or capture is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if limit <= 0.

      • getIntersections

        List<E> getIntersections(List<E> contained,
                         Point point,
                         int limit)

        Adds to a List each Partitionable, up to limit instances, such that each instance b intersects with the given Point described as (b.contains(point)).

        Parameters:
        contained - list of results.
        point - intersecting point.
        limit - max number of partitionables.
        Returns:
        contained, or null if none were contained.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if contained list or point is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if limit <= 0.

      • isEmpty

        default boolean isEmpty()

        Checks if Partitionable count == 0.

        Returns:
        true if #size() == 0.

      • remove

        boolean remove(E partitionable)

        Removes a Partitionable.

        Parameters:
        partitionable - partitionable.
        Returns:
        false if partitionable was not found.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if partitionable is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the partitionable has a property disallowed by the tree.

      • size

        int size()

        Gets the number of Partitionables in the tree.

        Returns:
        count.

      • update

        boolean update(E partitionable)

        Updates if necessary a Partitionable's position in the tree's hierarchy should its position be invalid.

        Parameters:
        partitionable - partitionable.
        Returns:
        true if corrective operations were done.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if partitionable is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the partitionable has a property disallowed by the tree.
